item.title: Alternative Rural Broadband Solution
item.description: For those living and working in rural areas, limited internet options can be a major problem. While major providers often only service cities, there are ways to stay connected without spending a fortune or waiting years for expanded infrastructure. Forget DSL or cable â€“ those are rare finds outside city limits. While universal telephone service guarantees basic phone lines (and thus, very slow dial-up internet), there’s a better option for fast, affordable internet: the existing cell phone network.
